intro: Eurybia ferresii, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, gray-green leaves and sturdy stems that rise above them. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Eurybia ferresii is often found in prairies, meadows, and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
